column4: i just got an error from a make (of some sort) that it couldnt find SSL library. I have added an ssl switch to the compile instructions manually. But i do have installed openssl, via apt-get. Any place you know i should look for paths?
its mutt that im trying to make btw, and i'm using dpkg-buildpackage
have you installed the ssl dev package?
so thats something i am gonna need?
ah ok...  any idea what it may be called?
ok thanks! so it has no connection namewise to openssl ?
the issue isn't related to PPC, its simply that you have an old version of ubuntu
eye know ... but _when_ i upgrade that version, there will probably be special cases since i'm on PPC
need to search locally, for what i have installed .... not for what is available for download
dpkg -l will output all packages and their states
